channel.title: An idea
channel.description: ;) I heard this was done before. Basicly it is a client with a huge map. So you can see everywhere in the whole of rs on your world. This would be usefull for finding out where people are. Im not sure if this is possible + if it is which i hope then it would have to load all parts of the map not just the part you are in. And watch me get loads of replies saying this will never work :rolleyes: but its a good idea.

item.title: An idea
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

RLN:

You would have to load all the maps at once. Easier said then done. I've tried several times on rsc and it never worked

An in general, RSC is easier to mod than RS2...so this might be a bit of a mission - but hey if its done, itll be worth it!

Read full topic

item.title: An idea
item.dc:creator: @iruleatants iruleatants
item.description:
@iruleatants wrote:

its called a maphack, im sure you can get the great and mighty[/sarcasm] java hacking team to do this....

if your spells didnt have range limit then you could kill without worries...(except for walls)

Read full topic

item.title: An idea
item.dc:creator: @kmb Kmb
item.description:
@kmb wrote:

This is possible, it has been done in rsc several times. It's just pretty hard to disable the fog of war, someone bug Pplsuqbawlz, I think i saw a post by him about something related to this subject on kaitnieks.

Edit: Ok, I think I misunderstood the point. I thought you were talking about just zooming out so you could see everywhere on your current loaded area. It is a BIT harder to load every single area at once, and it will most likely take some time too :P.

Read full topic

item.title: An idea

item.description:
@css wrote:

winterlove did it in #317 in a private server

I heard this was done before.
Basicly it is a client with a huge map.
So you can see everywhere in the whole of rs on your world.
This would be usefull for finding out where people are.
Im not sure if this is possible + if it is which i hope then it would have to load all parts of the map not just the part you are in.
And watch me get loads of replies saying this will never work :rolleyes: but its a good idea.
